metadata.funder: IMIM - Hospital del Mar Research Institute
metadata.description:
Federated architecture deployment of the MAPBM project (MAPBM 2.0). 
Maturity Assessment Model in PBM. Empowering hospitals to reduce unnecessary transfusions and improve patient outcomes. 
MAPBM is a collaborative network of hospitals dedicated to advancing the implementation of evidence-based Patient Blood Management (PBM) strategies into practice to drive better patient outcomes.
Three main working areas:
- Measuring & Benchmarking - evaluating PBM practices across hospitals using routinely collected hospital data.
- Community of Practice - PBM leads sharing experiences, knowledge, and solutions to promote continuous improvement.
- Generating Real-World Evidence (RWE) - producing scientific evidence on PBM to inform practice and policy.
metadata.notes: v.0.0.2: 1) Updated cohort inclusion and exclusion catalogues. 2) Updated all entities excluding calculated variables related to comorbidities, medication status and complications transfered to the analyses. 3) Updated comorbidities, medication and complications definition catalogues to consider in the analysis. 4) Added POAD characterising episode diagnoses. 5) Reviewed and checked datetime timestamp formats and specification. 6) Reviewed and reassessed information requirement at variable level for all entities. 7) Checked conformity of the categorical variables to comply with used standards. PENDING: a) Check information requierement on drug definition using National Catalogue ID code. b) Check funding declaration. c) Add authoring and contributors.

cohort.name: MAPBM
cohort.description: Federated deployment pilot study for the MAPBM project. Patients from a subset of MAPBM hospitals network who underwent the following elective or onchologic interventions: total knee or hip arthroplasty, colorectal cancer surgery, cardiac valve surgery, gastrointestinal bleeding or histerctomy, as well as urgent femur fracture procedures; in order to explore hospitals' adherence to the MAPBM program and patients' postoperative outcomes.
cohort.inclusion_criteria: Patients who underwent total knee or hip arthroplasty, colorectal cancer surgery, cardiac valve surgery, gastrointestinal bleeding, histerectomy or femur fracture procedures.
cohort.exclusion_criteria:
Incomplete date and time information for surgery, laboratory or transfusion data. 
Lack of preoperative hemoglobin measurement.

variables.label: anesth_cd
variables.description: Type of anesthesia used during the intervention

variables.label: asa_cd
variables.description: ASA (American Society of Anesthesiologists) physical status classification

variables.label: brs_bl
variables.description: Usage of blood recovery system during the intervention

variables.label: planification_cd
variables.description: Planification of care: urgent, scheduled, unknown
variables.observations_comments: "1"= Urgent care provided; "2"= Scheduled care provided; "9"= Unknown planification of care

variables.label: determination_cd
variables.observations_comments: "hb"= Hemoglobin (g/dL); "ret_he"= Reticulocyte hemoglobin (pg); "ferr"= ferritin (ng/mL); "gfr"= Glomerular Filtration Rate; "crp"= C reactive protein (mg/L); "b12" = Cobalamin (mcg); "fol"= Folic acid (mcg); "tsi"= Transferrin Saturation Index; "fib"= Fibrinogen (g/L); "plat"= Platelets (x10^9/L); "viiif"= VIII factor (IU/dL); "p_time" = Prothrombin time (INR)

variables.label: determination_dt
variables.observations_comments: Attention! Laboratory samples must be collected up to 120 days before the start of the study period (September 2021)

variables.label: result_determination_cd
variables.observations_comments: Each measure must be reported in its indicated unit

variables.label: transf_administered_bl
variables.observations_comments: If transfusion bag/unit administered (not returned to blood bank), value is true

variables.label: last_dispensation_dt
variables.description: Date of last drug dispensing from pharmacy

variables.label: technique_cd
variables.description: Technique used to test the sample (TEG, TEM or SRM)

variables.label: tegdet_cd
variables.observations_comments: "ci"= Coagulation index; "rtime"= R-time (min); "rtimehep"= R time heparinase (min); "act"= Activated clotting time (s); "ma"= Maximum amplitude (mm); "alpha"= Alpha angle (º); "ly30"= percentage of clot breakdown 30 minutes after MA (%)

variables.label: temdet_cd
variables.observations_comments: ct_fib= Clotting time, FIBTEM assay (s); ct_ex= Clotting time, EXTEM assay (s); ct_in= Clotting time, INTEM assay (s); ct_hep= Clotting time, HEPTEM assay (s); a5_ex= Amplitude of the clot 5 minutes after CT, EXTEM assay (mm); a5_ap= Amplitude of the clot 5 minutes after CT, APTEM assay (mm); a5_fib= Amplitude of the clot 5 minutes after CT, FIBTEM assay (mm); a10_ex= Amplitude of the clot 10 minutes after CT, EXTEM assay (mm); a10_ap= Amplitude of the clot 10 minutes after CT,

variables.label: srmdet_cd
variables.observations_comments: ct= Clotting time (s); cth= Heparinase clotting time (s); ctr= Clotting time ratio; cs= Total clot stiffness (hPa); pcs= Platelet contribution to clot stiffness (hPa); fcs= Fibrinogen contribution to clot stiffness (hPa); csl= Clot stability to lysis (%)

variables.label: result_nm
variables.observations_comments: Each measure must be reported in its indicated unit
